translations.translation: Order a vRack
Click here to create a new vRack.
Your vRack is currently being created. Try again shortly.
Arrange your vRack
Adding a server to the virtual rack requires the professional use option. It will be added to your order automatically if your server doesn't already have it.
Add/withdraw services to/from your vRack:
[in progress]
Your servers
Your vRack
An error occurred.
Add
Remove
Creating a vRack
Enter the number of vRacks you wish to order:
Number of vRacks:
I confirm having read and fully understood the following conditions:
Unable to order {0} vRack:
The request to enable your vRack was registered and will take effect shortly, as soon as the order number {1} has been confirmed.
An error occurred on requesting to create your vRack.
Your vRack modification request has been registered successfully.
Your vRack modification request was registered for some servers, but there were errors with others.
An error occurred on requesting to modify your vRack.
See the details of the errors
In order to activate the integration of your dedicated server into the vRack 1.5, you need to carry out an arping command on the IP 1.1.1.1 (example : arping -i eth1/3 1.1.1.1).
Once your IP has been integrated into the vRack, to activate it you have to assign a zone by clicking on
Once the IP has been added to the vRack, it must be assigned a zone.
The IP zone has not been defined. Click here to define it
Assigning the zone
Select the zone you want to assign to the IP {0}
Confirmation of zone assignment
IP:
Zone:
The zone {0} will be assigned to the IP {1} shortly
An error occurred on assigning the zone {0} to the IP {1}
An error occurred on retrieving the zones available for the IP {0}
You have reached the limit for the number of vRacks available. You can't order any more.
